snippet: A week after Islamabad reopened United States and NATO supply lines to Afghanistan, only a handful of trucks have crossed the border, Pakistani officials said Wednesday.
abstract: Pakistani officials report only a handful of trucks have crossed the border into Afghanistan since it was reopened for United States and NATO supply lines; officials blame Pakistan’s bureaucracy and the need for new customs clearances for the delays.
lead_paragraph: A week after Islamabad reopened United States and NATO supply lines to Afghanistan, only a handful of trucks have crossed the border, Pakistani officials said Wednesday.

headline.seo: Pakistan: NATO Supply Traffic Is Slow at Border
